Uses of Class
com.vmware.appliance.vcenter.settings.v1.config.components.inventory.cluster.ha.FailuresAndResponses.Builder

  • Packages that use FailuresAndResponses.Builder 
    Package Description
    com.vmware.appliance.vcenter.settings.v1.config.components.inventory.cluster.ha
    The com.vmware.appliance.vcenter.settings.v1.config.components.inventory.cluster.ha package provides interfaces to manage the vCenter Server Inventory Cluster HA settings.

      After condition has been met, a mandatory delay before starting the next VM restart priority.

      Restart priority for a virtual machine.
      FailuresAndResponses.Builder FailuresAndResponses.Builder.setHostIsolationResponse(FailuresAndResponses.IsolationResponse hostIsolationResponse)
      Indicates whether or not the virtual machine should be powered off if a host determines that it is isolated from the rest of the compute resource.
      FailuresAndResponses.Builder FailuresAndResponses.Builder.setHostMonitoring(FailuresAndResponses.ServiceState hostMonitoring) 
      FailuresAndResponses.Builder FailuresAndResponses.Builder.setResponseDelay(java.lang.Long responseDelay)
      The time interval after an APD timeout has been declared and before VM Component Protection service will terminate the VM.
      FailuresAndResponses.Builder FailuresAndResponses.Builder.setResponseRecovery(FailuresAndResponses.VmReactionOnAPDCleared responseRecovery)
      Action taken by VM Component Protection service for a powered on VM when APD condition clears after APD timeout.
      FailuresAndResponses.Builder FailuresAndResponses.Builder.setRestartPriorityConditionTimeout(java.lang.Long restartPriorityConditionTimeout)
      This setting is used to specify a maximum time the lower priority VMs should wait for the higher priority VMs to be ready.
